Description: Tapestry square applied and sewn to an undyed linen, plain weave textile; the tapestry decoration is a bird with a beige, grey, light blue and blue plummage, and beige and pink legs and beak; mauve (?), beige and yellow eye; oriented to the right; in the top left hand corner is a yellow cross within a vegetal and floral wreath/crown; on a purple background; the square is framed by a beige plain band and a red plain band; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/24), weft-undyed linen (S/9); tapestry on single threads: warp-undyed linen (S/11), weft-beige, yellow, pink, mauve, grey, purple, red, light and blue, light and dark green wool (S/56); oversewing in red wool (S/some grouped by 2); edges cut and ragged
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
